transcript: Schon Grabern affair and by the retreat from Auster- litz, where he alone had withdrawn his col- umn unbroken and had all day beaten back an enemy force twice as numerous as his own. What also conduced to Bagrati6n's being se- lected as Moscow's hero was the fact that he had no connections in the city and was a stran- ger there. In his person, honor was shown to a simple fighting Russian soldier without con- nections and intrigues, and to one who was as- sociated by memories of the Italian camp
